required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Surveillance Protocol of Carbaglu® for the Treatment of Hyperammonemia
clinical_study.official_title: A Surveillance Protocol of Carbaglu® for the Treatment of Hyperammonemia Due to Methylmalonic Acidemia (MMA) and Propionic Acidemia (PA) in Adult and Pediatric Patient Populations

brief_summary.textblock: To obtain short-term and long-term clinical safety information, in pediatric and adult patients with PA and MMA treated with Carbaglu®.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is being conducted to obtain short-term and long-term clinical safety information from adult and pediatric patients treated for hyperammonemia due to Methylmalonic Acidemia (MMA) and Propionic Acidemia (PA). This study will collect data on; developmental outcomes, details of treatment with Carbaglu® and other treatments for hyperammonemia including dietary and protein management, plasma ammonia levels, pregnancy and maternal complications, adverse effects on the developing fetus and neonate, adverse effects on the infant through first year of life.

primary_outcome.measure: Effects of Carbaglu® on plasma ammonia levels
primary_outcome.time_frame: Plasma levels will be collected during treatment with Carbaglu®
primary_outcome.description: Multiple plasma ammonia levels will be collected during treatment with Carbaglu®

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Carbaglu® Related Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: Any Carbaglu® related adverse events will be be collected and reported

arm_group.arm_group_label: Male and Female Adult and Pediatric Participants
arm_group.description: Patients treated with carglumic acid for the treatment for hyperammonemia due to Methylmalonic Acidemia (MMA) and Propionic Acidemia (PA)

intervention.description: The dose of Carbaglu® prescribed will be determined by the investigator for each individual patient.
intervention.arm_group_label: Male and Female Adult and Pediatric Participants

study_pop.textblock: Adult and Pediatric patients of both genders including Newborns, diagnosed with hyperammonemia due to Methylmalonic Acidemia (MMA) and Propionic Acidemia (PA)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Provision of signed and dated informed consent/assent form
2. Prescribed and treated with Carbaglu®
3. Have an established diagnosis of PA or MMA defined as follows:
- Diagnosed with PA by semi quantitative urine organic acid analysis, defined as presence of elevated methylcitric acid and normal methylmalonic acid levels and no evidence of biotin related disorders in the organic acid analysis; OR
- Diagnosed with MMA by semi quantitative urine organic acid analysis, defined as elevation of methylmalonic acid and no evidence of vitamin B12 dependent disorder on plasma amino acid analysis (vitamin B12 dependency is defined by documented vitamin B12 responsiveness).
AND/OR
- Confirmation by molecular genetic testing
Exclusion Criteria:
- None
